abstract: For the protesters at Zuccotti Park, bathing is a problem, but nobody is starving. A makeshift kitchen and food donated via the Internet help feed thousands every day.
snippet: For the protesters at Zuccotti Park, bathing is a problem, but nobody is starving. A makeshift kitchen and food donated via the Internet help feed thousands every day.
lead_paragraph: Living on the streets of New York can no doubt be uncomfortable, unsanitary and lacking in privacy. But for the Occupy Wall Street protesters, food is not an issue, reports Jeff Gordinier for the Dining Section.

headline.main: An Abundant Menu at Occupy Wall Street
